meanings.definition: The quality or state of being stubborn or obstinate.
meanings.sent1: Her mulishnesses made it difficult to convince her to try new foods.
meanings.sent2: His mulishnesses in refusing to listen to others' opinions caused tension in the group.
meanings.sent3: Despite his mulishnesses, she managed to persuade him to go on the roller coaster.
meanings.sent4: The mulishnesses of the old oak tree refusing to bend to the wind was admirable.
meanings.sent5: The mulishnesses of the toddler insisting on wearing mismatched socks was endearing.

meanings.definition: The behavior or attitude of being unreasonably resistant to change or compromise.
meanings.sent1: Dealing with his mulishnesses in negotiations was challenging.
meanings.sent2: The team's mulishnesses in adapting to new technology hindered progress.
meanings.sent3: His mulishnesses in wanting to take the scenic route led to a longer road trip.
meanings.sent4: The mulishnesses of the old car refusing to start on cold mornings was frustrating.
meanings.sent5: The mulishnesses of the cat in refusing to eat anything but tuna was amusing.
